title: 154: Herding cats the right way according to Milton
dc:creator: A.J. Hanenburg
description: As the archangel Michael boots Adam and Eve from Paradise, he gives Adam a vision of the future to, you know, make him feel better. Adam then says that he knows what is right now, and that man only has to obey. Was Milton making a statement about the ways in which we should conduct ourselves in regard to curiosity? I mean, probs.
itunes:author: Three pretty disinterested guys. Knowledge is all whatever.
itunes:subtitle: I can't decide if that title needs a comma or not
